perturbation.original_text: This Agreement may be terminated by either party at the expiration of its term or any renewal term upon thirty (30) days written notice to the other party. Company acknowledges that this Agreement shall not be terminated for MA's failure to follow an operating plan, standard procedure, training manual, or substantial equivalent published in Paragraph 3 (k) of this Agreement, except that Company does reserve the right to terminate this Agreement for MA's failure to follow required procedures relating to the processing of sales contracts, invoices and billing related to Technology sold under this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: This Agreement may be terminated by either party at the expiration of its term or any renewal term upon ten (10) days written notice to the other party. Company acknowledges that this Agreement shall not be terminated for MA's failure to follow an operating plan, standard procedure, training manual, or substantial equivalent published in Paragraph 3 (k) of this Agreement, except that Company does reserve the right to terminate this Agreement for MA's failure to follow required procedures relating to the processing of sales contracts, invoices and billing related to Technology sold under this Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: Reducing the notice period for termination to ten days may conflict with state laws that require longer notice periods for contract termination, especially if the agreement implies an ongoing business relationship or investment.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Potentially conflicts with state contract laws requiring reasonable notice for termination, depending on the specific nature of the agreement and jurisdiction.

perturbation.original_text: Material breach of any covenant, term, condition or other provisions of this Agreement, which breach is not remedied within ten (10) days after notice of such breach is received by the breaching party;
perturbation.changed_text: Material breach of any covenant, term, condition or other provisions of this Agreement, which breach is not remedied within two (2) days after notice of such breach is received by the breaching party;
perturbation.explanation: Reducing the cure period for a material breach to two days may be unreasonably short and could be deemed unconscionable under contract law, as it may not provide sufficient time for the breaching party to rectify the issue.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Potentially conflicts with principles of contract law regarding reasonable opportunity to cure breaches, varying by state.

perturbation.original_text:
MA shall report periodically in writing, upon request to Company the status of the following:

Leads provided by Company Marketing activities in progress Sales forecasts Implementations in progress
perturbation.changed_text:
MA shall report only verbally the status of the following:

Leads provided by Company Marketing activities in progress Sales forecasts Implementations in progress
perturbation.explanation: Changing the report from written to verbal may allow information to be misinterpreted, and is less traceable. Also the company only requests the reports, but does not specify how often these reports are requested, giving the company the ability to use this to their advantage and request this information on an extremely short, periodic basis. This may be a violation of work hour laws.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Potentially conflicts with principles of contract law regarding working hours, depending on the jurisdiction.
